# Standard Input

> [Standard input][standard-streams].

<!-- <usage> -->

## Usage

``` javascript
var stdin = require( '@stdlib/streams/base/stdin' );
```

#### stdin

[Standard input][standard-streams] as a [Readable stream][readable-stream].

``` javascript
var data = [];
var len = 0;

stdin.on( 'readable', onReadable );
stdin.on( 'error', onError );
stdin.on( 'end', onEnd );

function onReadable() {
    var chunk;
    while ( true ) {
        chunk = stdin.read();
        if ( chunk === null ) {
            break;
        }
        data.push( chunk );
        len += chunk.length;
    }
}

function onError( error ) {
    if ( error ) {
        throw error;
    }
}

function onEnd() {
    data = Buffer.concat( data, len );
    console.log( data.toString() );
    // returns '...'
}
```

<!-- </usage> -->


<!-- <examples> -->

## Examples

``` javascript
var stdin = require( '@stdlib/streams/base/stdin' );
var stdout = require( '@stdlib/streams/base/stdout' );

// Set the encoding:
stdin.setEncoding( 'utf8' );

// Create an echo stream:
stdin.pipe( stdout );

// Push data to `stdin`:
stdin.push( 'beep' );
stdin.push( ' '  );
stdin.push( 'boop' );
stdin.push( '\n' );

// End the stream:
stdin.push( null );
```

<!-- </examples> -->
